column4: Peru's Credicorp posts 12.3% yr/yr rise in net profit in Q2
column5: LIMA, Aug 8 (Reuters) - Peruvian financial holding company Credicorp posted 1.099 billion soles ($325.7 mln) in net profit in the second quarter, up 12.3% from the same period a year earlier thanks to growth in loan balances, the company said on Thursday.
column6: The company, which owns Peru’s largest bank, Banco de Credito, said growth was led by retail banking, especially in mortgages, credit cards and loans for small businesses.
column7: A 6.5% year-on-year increase in average daily loan balances helped offset higher expenses for interest on deposits, it said. (Reporting by Mitra Taj; Editing by Sandra Maler)

column4: Peru's Credicorp says net profit fell 10 percent in fourth quarter
column5: LIMA (Reuters) - Peruvian holding company Credicorp Ltd said on Wednesday that it earned 956.9 mln soles ($288 mln) in net profit in the fourth quarter, a 10 percent drop from the same quarter a year earlier.
column6: The company, which owns Peru’s biggest bank, said its operating expenses rose on higher salaries and administrative costs in the fourth quarter, offsetting a nearly 11 percent rise in average daily loan balances.

column4: Peru's Credicorp third quarter net profit fell 17 percent
column5: LIMA (Reuters) - Peruvian holding company Credicorp's BAP.N third quarter net profit fell 17 percent year-on-year to 1 billion soles ($301 million), the company said on Wednesday.
column6: The company said its net profit for the third quarter last year had been higher because it sold its shares in a Chilean bank. It noted its third quarter net profit this year was 3.4 percent higher than the second quarter.

column4: Peru's Credicorp Q2 net profit rises
column5: LIMA, Aug 8 (Reuters) - Credicorp Ltd , Peru’s largest financial holding company, said on Wednesday it earned 977.8 million soles ($300 million) in second-quarter net profit, up 6.3 percent from a year earlier.
column6: The gains reflected a gradual recovery in loan growth, and that it has continued to improve the risk quality of its loan portfolio, said Credicorp.

column4: BRIEF-Credicorp Transferred Bolsa De Valores De Lima To Its Unit
column6: * CREDICORP LTD - TRANSFERRED OVER THE BOLSA DE VALORES DE LIMA TO ITS UNIT, 220 MILLION SHARES OF BANCO DE CREDITO DEL PERU (BCP) OWNED BY CO - SEC FILING
column7: * CREDICORP LTD - THROUGH ITS SUBSIDIARY GRUPO CREDITO S.A. , WILL CONTINUE TO OWN 97.69% OF THE SHARES OF BANCO DE CREDITO DEL PERU Source text: (bit.ly/2FS4f9O) Further company coverage:

column4: Peru's Credicorp Q1 net profit jumps 16.7 pct vs year ago
column5: LIMA, May 3 (Reuters) - Peru’s largest financial holding company, Credicorp Ltd, earned 1.037 billion soles ($317 million) in net profit in the first quarter, up 16.7 percent from the same period a year earlier, the company said on Thursday.
column6: Credicorp said its average daily loan balances expanded by 7 percent in the first quarter year-on-year, reflecting a gradual recovery in loan growth, and that it has improved the risk quality of its loan portfolio.

column4: BRIEF-Credicorp Ltd Says Notifies That Its CEO, Walter Bayly, Had A Coronary Event During Weekend
column6: * CREDICORP LTD SAYS NOTIFIES THAT ITS CEO, WALTER BAYLY, HAD A CORONARY EVENT DURING WEEKEND
column7: * CREDICORP LTD - DURING ABSENCE OF BAYLY THE TWO DEPUTY CEOS, ALVARO CORREA AND GIANFRANCO FERRARI, WILL ASSUME BAYLY’S RESPONSIBILITIES Source text for Eikon: Further company coverage: (Reuters.Briefs@thomsonreuters.com)
